publisher.value: Agence du Numérique en Santé (ANS) - 2-10 Rue d'Oradour-sur-Glane, 75015 Paris

name.value: Agence du Numérique en Santé (ANS) - 2-10 Rue d'Oradour-sur-Glane, 75015 Paris

description.value: L'élément de l'en-tête du CDA correspond au nom d'une personne physique.

short.value: Base for all types and resources

definition.value: A name for a person. A sequence of name parts, such as given name or family name, prefix, suffix, etc. Examples for person name values are "Jim Bob Walton, Jr.", "Adam Everyman", etc. A person name may be as simple as a character string or may consist of several person name parts, such as, "Jim", "Bob", "Walton", and "Jr.". PN differs from EN because the qualifier type cannot include LS (Legal Status).

human.value: No PN name part may have a qualifier of LS.

definition.value: If a value is an exceptional value (NULL-value), this specifies in what way and why proper information is missing.

A set of codes advising a system or user which name in a set of like names to select for a given purpose. A name without specific use code might be a default name useful for any purpose, but a name with a specific use code would be preferred for that respective purpose
A series of items that constitute the name.

human.value: Can only have only one of the possible item elements in each choice

short.value: Nom de famille ou nom d’usage

comment.value: This element is represented in XML as textual content. The actual name "xmlText" will not appear in a CDA instance.

definition.value: An interval of time specifying the time during which the name is or was used for the entity. This accomodates the fact that people change names for people, places and things.

short.value: Nom de famille ou nom d’usage
